main.enactingFormula: (Cap. 13, section 20(6), Cap. 16, section 9A(6) and Cap. 192, section 28(6))

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: attachment order (扣押令) means an attachment of income order made under section 20 of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13), section 9A of the Separation and Maintenance Orders Ordinance (Cap. 16) or section 28 of the Matrimonial Proceedings and Property Ordinance (Cap. 192) and includes a variation of an attachment of income order made under rule 9;
income source (入息來源) means a person by whom the income of the maintenance payer is payable and includes the Government; (20 of 2007 s. 8)

judgment rate (判定利率) means the rate of interest determined by the Chief Justice under section 49(1)(b) of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) or section 50(1)(b) of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336), as the case may be; (18 of 2003 s. 16)

related maintenance order (有關贍養令) means the maintenance order defined in section 2 of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13), section 2 of the Separation and Maintenance Orders Ordinance (Cap. 16) or section 2 of the Matrimonial Proceedings and Property Ordinance (Cap. 192), as may be appropriate, and the enforcement of which is the subject of an application under these Rules; (20 of 2001 s. 5; 18 of 2003 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designated payee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the specified payee is not the designated payee, both the designated payee and specified payee; (L.N. 260 of 2001)

section.def: statement of means (經濟能力陳述書) means a statement of the income and expenses of a maintenance payer in such form as may be prescribed by the Chief Justice;
wages (工資) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57), whether the wages are payable by the Government or any other person. (20 of 2007 s. 8)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Application for attachment order to be made by summons or originating summons
section.content: An application for an attachment order shall be made by a summons or an originating summons.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Requirements relating to application made by designated payee

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application for an attachment order by the designated payee. (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be supported by an affidavit of the designated payee stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the designated payee, and the designated payee’s address for service of documents relating to the application; (L.N. 197 of 1998; L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and the last known address of the maintenance payer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of the related maintenance order;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the case number of the previous proceedings under which the related maintenance order was made;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date of service of the related maintenance order, and in the case of its not having been served, the reason for its non-service;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if the application is made on the ground that the maintenance payer has defaulted in payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the maintenance payer has defaulted in payment and that, to the honest belief of the designated payee, there is no reasonable excuse for that default; (18 of 2003 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: particulars of the default, including the amount in default and the arrears accrued at the date of the affidavit; (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the interest payable in respect of arrears of maintenance that the designated payee is entitled to under section 20A(2) of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13), section 9B(2) of the Separation and Maintenance Orders Ordinance (Cap. 16), section 53A(2) of the Matrimonial Causes Ordinance (Cap. 179) or section 28AA(2) of the Matrimonial Proceedings and Property Ordinance (Cap. 192), as the case may be; and (18 of 2003 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the surcharge payable in respect of arrears of maintenance under section 20B(1) of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13), section 9C(1) of the Separation and Maintenance Orders Ordinance (Cap. 16), section 53B(1) of the Matrimonial Causes Ordinance (Cap. 179) or section 28AB(1) of the Matrimonial Proceedings and Property Ordinance (Cap. 192), as the case may be; (18 of 2003 s. 17)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: if the application is made on the ground that the maintenance payer will not make full and punctual payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that, to the honest belief of the designated payee, the maintenance payer will not make full and punctual payment in compliance with the related maintenance order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the reasons for such a belief; (L.N. 260 of 2001)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the case number of any judgment summons already issued and particulars of any other execution proceedings already instituted to enforce the related maintenance order; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: if known to the designated payee, the name and address of the income source and the nature of the income. (L.N. 197 of 1998)

subsection.content: The designated payee shall serve a sealed copy of the summons with a copy of the affidavit in support on the maintenance payer. Every copy of a summons for service on the maintenance payer shall be accompanied by a form of statement of means in Form 1 in the Schedule.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Requirements relating to joint application made by maintenance payer and designated payee

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application for an attachment order jointly by the maintenance payer and the designated payee.

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be supported by an affidavit made jointly by the applicants stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of each applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the related maintenance order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the income source;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature of the income to be attached; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the terms of the attachment order that the applicants invite the court to make.

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of means in Form 1 in the Schedule, signed by the maintenance payer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subrule (4), a statement of verification completed and signed by the income source, or if there is more than one income source, each income source, in the same form as that attached to Form 3 in the Schedule.

subsection.content: If the statement of verification referred to in subrule (3)(b) is not available, the application shall be accompanied by a statement of the maintenance payer setting out the efforts made to obtain the statement of verification and the reasons for it not being available.

section.name: s3B
section.heading: Requirements relating to application made by maintenance payer

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application for an attachment order by the maintenance payer.

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be supported by an affidavit made by the maintenance payer stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the maintenance payer and the name and address of the designated payee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the related maintenance order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the income source;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature of the income to be attached;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the terms of the attachment order that the maintenance payer invites the court to make; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the grounds for the application.

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of means in Form 1 in the Schedule, signed by the maintenance payer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subrule (4), a statement of verification completed and signed by the income source or, if there is more than one income source, each income source, in the same form as that attached to Form 3 in the Schedule.

subsection.content: If the statement of verification referred to in subrule (3)(b) is not available, the application shall be accompanied by a statement of the maintenance payer setting out the efforts made to obtain the statement of verification and the reasons for it not being available.

subsection.leadIn: The maintenance payer shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after making the application, serve on the designated payee a copy of the summons and affidavit together with a copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statements referred to in subrule (3)(a) and (b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement referred to in subrule (3)(a) and the statement on the efforts made to obtain the statement of verification referred to in subrule (4).

section.name: s3C
section.heading: Making of attachment order by court on its own motion

subsection.leadIn: Where the court intends to make an attachment order on its own motion, the court may make an order in Form 2A in the Schedule directing the maintenance payer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to file in court, within the period specified in the order, a statement of means in Form 1 in the Schedule signed by the maintenance payer; and (L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to serve a copy of the statement on the designated payee as soon as reasonably practicable after filing it.

subsection.content: The court may, before making an attachment order, order the maintenance payer to provide information which the court considers necessary.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Signed statement to be filed by maintenance payer

subsection.content: The maintenance payer shall, within 14 days of service on him or her of the documents referred to in rule 3(3), file in court a statement of means, signed by him or her and thereafter shall immediately serve a copy of the same on the designated payee. (L.N. 80 of 2012)

Where the maintenance payer has failed to comply with subrule (1), the court may, on an ex parte application made to it by the designated payee, make an order in Form 2 in the Schedule directing the maintenance payer to make good the default within 7 days of the date of the order.
An application under subrule (2) shall be supported by an affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: Where the court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receives the signed statement of means filed under rule 3C or 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: receives a statement on the efforts made to obtain the statement of verification referred to in rule 3A(4) or 3B(4),

subsection.continued: the court shall make an order in Form 3 in the Schedule requiring the annex to the signed statement of means to be verified by the income source of the maintenance payer. (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The court shall serve the order on the income source, or if there is more than one income source, serve a separate order accompanied by the relevant annex to the signed statement of means on each income source. (L.N. 260 of 2001)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The income source or, where the income source is the Government, a public body, body corporate or body unincorporate, an authorized person on its behalf, shall complete, sign and file the statement of verification attached to the order within 14 days of the date of the order. (20 of 2007 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Where the named income source has never been or has ceased to be an income source of the maintenance payer prior to the date of the order, the named income source shall notify the court in Form 5 in the Schedule within 7 days of the date of the order. (L.N. 80 of 2012)

subsection.content: Upon receipt of the signed statement of verification, the court shall send a copy of the same to the designated payee and the maintenance payer.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Making of attachment order in the same hearing in which related maintenance order is made

subsection.leadIn: The following provision applies where one party seeks or both parties jointly seek an attachment order to be made in the same hearing in which the related maintenance order is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the party or parties shall file in court a notice of intention to seek an attachment order to be made in the same hearing in which the related maintenance order is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice under paragraph (a) shall be in Form 3A in the Schedule and may be filed at any stage of the proceedings before a related maintenance order is made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the notice is filed by one party only, that party shall serve a copy of the notice on the other party immediately after it is filed in court; (L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: after the related maintenance order is made, the court may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: exercise its discretion to make an attachment order on its own motion in the same hearing in which the maintenance order is made; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: adjourn the hearing and direct the parties to supply further information.

subsection.def: In this rule, party (一方) means a person who will be the designated payee or the maintenance payer on the making of a related maintenance order.

subsection.content: Where the maintenance payer has more than one income source, the court shall have the discretion in deciding to which income source or income sources an attachment order shall be directed.
An attachment order shall be in accordance with Form 4 in the Schedule.

When the court makes an attachment order, it may at the same time make an order to vary or discharge any other order, including another attachment order in force at the material time, in relation to the enforcement of the related maintenance order.

subsection.leadIn: The designated payee shall serve a sealed copy of the attachment order, either personally or by registered post on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the maintenance payer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the income source to whom the attachment order is directed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the specified payee is not the designated payee, the specified payee. (L.N. 260 of 2001)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Compliance with order by income source

subsection.content: Where an attachment order has been made, the income source shall, on being served with the order, comply with it 14 days after the date of service, or, if the attachment order specifies a later date, at the later date; but the income source shall be under no liability for non-compliance before 14 days have elapsed since the service.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (3), the income source—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall deduct from the maintenance payer’s income such amount as specified in the attachment order at the next payment of such income following the date on which the income source is required to comply with the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall pay the deducted amount to the specified payee in the manner as directed in the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may, during the period when the order is in force, make one further deduction of such amount, not exceeding $500, as the court may direct, from the income of the maintenance payer, to defray the administrative expenses reasonably incurred by the income source in complying with the order. In the case of the order being varied under rule 9, another deduction of such amount, not exceeding $500, as the court may direct, may be allowed to defray the administrative expenses reasonably incurred in connection with the variation provided the court so ordered.

subsection.leadIn: Where an income source is unable to comply with the order in full by reason of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reduction in the income of the maintenance payer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the circumstances referred to in section 20(5) of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13), section 9A(5) of the Separation and Maintenance Orders Ordinance (Cap. 16) or section 28(5) of the Matrimonial Proceedings and Property Ordinance (Cap. 192), as the case may be,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: pay to the specified payee— (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a), the reduced income of the maintenance payer in full;

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: inform the specified payee and the maintenance payer of— (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the reasons for not being able to pay the specified payee the full amount specified in the attachment order; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the amount which has actually been paid to the specified payee.

subsection.content: If before the receipt of the attachment order or at any time when the attachment order is in force, an income source to whom an attachment order is directed ceases to be an income source of the maintenance payer, the income source shall notify the court and the specified payee within 7 days from the date of the receipt of the attachment order or within 7 days from such cesser, as the case may be. Such notification shall be in Form 5 in the Schedule.

Notwithstanding rule 7(3), the maintenance payer shall remain liable to pay the designated payee the balance between the amount specified in the attachment order and the amount which has actually been paid to the specified payee.

During the time when an attachment order is ineffective by reason of the circumstances referred to in rule 7(4), the maintenance payer shall remain liable to pay the designated payee the amount required in the related maintenance order as if the attachment order had not been made.

While an attachment order is in force and the amount ordered to be attached or, in the case of more than one attachment order in force concurrently, the amount in the aggregate so ordered, is less than the amount specified in the related maintenance order, the maintenance payer shall notify the relevant person in writing of any increase in the maintenance payer’s income or particulars of any new income source. Such notification shall be made within 7 days of the changes. (L.N. 80 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: Where an attachment order is in force and the maintenance payer ceases to receive any income from the income source to whom the order is directed (the original income source), the maintenance payer shall— (L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the maintenance payer has a new income source, within 21 days after he or she ceases to receive any income from the original income source— (L.N. 80 of 2012)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
iii
subparagraph.content: serve on the relevant person the documents referred to in rule 3B(5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the maintenance payer has no new income source, within 21 days after he or she ceases to receive any income from the original income source, notify the court and the relevant person in writing of the cessation, and state in the notice that he or she does not have any income capable of being attached. (L.N. 260 of 2001; L.N. 80 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subrule (4)(b), if subsequently a maintenance payer has a new income source, the maintenance payer shall, within 21 days after he or she is first entitled to receive any income from the new income source— (L.N. 7 of 2002; L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the court and the relevant person in writing of such fact and state in the notice the name and address of the new income source;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: serve on the relevant person the documents referred to in rule 3B(5). (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subsection.content: A maintenance payer who does not apply under subrule (4)(a)(ii) or (5)(b) for a new attachment order shall, within the period of 21 days referred to in subrule (4)(a) or (5), notify the court and the relevant person in writing and state in the notice that he or she does not wish to make such an application and the relevant reason. (L.N. 260 of 2001; L.N. 80 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: Where an attachment order is in force, the court may, on its own motion or upon application by an income source or upon application by the maintenance payer or the designated payee or both— (L.N. 260 of 2001)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary the attachment order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary the related maintenance order; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make a new attachment order in respect of a different or new income source of the maintenance payer.

subsection.content: An application for the variation of an attachment order shall be made by way of a summons.

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be supported by an affidavit stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the relevant person, and the person’s address for service of documents relating to the application; (L.N. 197 of 1998; L.N. 260 of 2001; L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and last known address of the maintenance payer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of the related maintenance order;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the case number of the previous proceedings under which the related maintenance order was made;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the case number of any judgment summons already issued and particulars of any other execution proceedings already instituted to enforce the related maintenance order;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the case number of the attachment order which the application seeks to vary; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the grounds for the application.

subsection.content: The court may order the maintenance payer or the income source to provide information which the court deems necessary.
An attachment order which is varied under this rule (a varied order) shall be in accordance with Form 4 in the Schedule.

Where an attachment order is varied, the varied order shall take effect on the expiry of the period of 14 days after the date of service of the varied order, or, if the varied order specifies a later date, on the later date.

Where an application under this rule is made, the applicant shall serve a sealed copy of the summons with a copy of the affidavit in support on all parties to the proceedings including the income source to whom the attachment order has been directed.
When a varied order is made, the applicant shall serve a copy of the varied order on all parties including the income source either personally or by registered post.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the effective period specified in an attachment order, the court may, if it thinks fit, discharge the attachment order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the application of the maintenance payer or the designated payee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon receipt of notification made by an income source under rule 7(4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: upon the discharge or lapse of the related maintenance order; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: when it exercises its power under rule 6(3).

subsection.content: An application for the discharge of an attachment order shall be made by way of a summons.

subsection.leadIn: The application shall be supported by an affidavit stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the relevant person, and the person’s address for service of documents relating to the application; (L.N. 197 of 1998; L.N. 260 of 2001; L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and last known address of the maintenance payer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of the related maintenance order;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the case number of the previous proceedings under which the related maintenance order was made;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the case number of any judgment summons already issued and particulars of any other execution proceedings already instituted to enforce the related maintenance order; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the grounds for the application.

subsection.content: An order to discharge shall be in accordance with Form 6 in the Schedule.
Rule 9(7) shall apply to an order to discharge under this rule as it applies to a variation of attachment order under rule 9.

subsection.leadIn: A maintenance payer who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with an order of the court under rule 3C, 4 or 9(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to notify the relevant person under rule 8(3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: knowingly makes a false statement in purported compliance with rule 3C, 4, 8(3), (4), (5) or (6) or 9(4);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with rule 8(4)(a) or (5), unless the maintenance payer complies with rule 8(6); or (L.N. 260 of 2001; L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with rule 8(4)(b), (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 1 month. (L.N. 260 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: An income source who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with an order of the court under rule 5(1), 7(1) or 9(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with rule 7(3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: knowingly makes a false statement in purported compliance with rule 5(2)(a) or (b), 7(4) or 9(4),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Service of documents
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to the provisions of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A), the Rules of the District Court (Cap. 336 sub. leg. H), Matrimonial Causes Rules (Cap. 179 sub. leg. A) and any other enactment relating to the service of documents and save as is otherwise expressly provided, any document required to be sent to or served on any person for the purposes of these Rules may— (L.N. 260 of 2001)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be personally given to or served on that person; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if that person is represented, by post to the solicitor acting for that person, or by leaving the same with the solicitor; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if that person is unrepresented, by post to the address for service given by that person or that person’s last known address, or by leaving the same at the address for service or the last known address of that person; or (L.N. 80 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where it is impracticable to serve a document which has to be served personally, be effected by substituted service if the court so orders; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be served in such other manner as the court may direct.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Dispensation with procedures and abridgement of time limit

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dispense with or relax any procedure specified in rules 3 to 8; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: abridge any time limit specified in rules 3 to 8,

section.continued: if the court is satisfied that it is fair and reasonable to do so in the circumstances of the case.
